com.aeonium.javafx.validation.annotations

Annotation Type FXString


  • @Documented
 @Target(value=FIELD)
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
public @interface FXString
    Define constraints for a string input field, e.g., minimum length and/or maximum length.
    Example: 
    
  @FXML
  @FXString(minLength = 2, maxLength = 5)
  private TextField name;
    Author:
    Robert Rohm <r.rohm@aeonium-systems.de>

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      int maxLength
      A allowed maximum length for the string value of the annotated control.
      java.lang.String messageMaxLength
      Message displayed when maximum length is exceeded - you can use %d as placeholder for the actual value.
      java.lang.String messageMinLength
      Message displayed when minimum length is not reached - you can use %d as placeholder for the actual value.
      int minLength
      A required minimum length for the string value of the annotated control.
      java.lang.String pattern
      Deprecated. 
      Not yet supported.
      java.lang.Class<? extends FXAbstractValidator> validation 

    • Element Detail

      • validation

        public abstract java.lang.Class<? extends FXAbstractValidator> validation
        Default:
        com.aeonium.javafx.validation.StringValidator.class

      • minLength

        public abstract int minLength
        A required minimum length for the string value of the annotated control. Set it to 0 ignore it, if not needed.
        Returns:
        The required minimum length.
        Default:
        0

      • maxLength

        public abstract int maxLength
        A allowed maximum length for the string value of the annotated control. Set it to 0 ignore it, if not needed.
        Returns:
        The required minimum length.
        Default:
        0

      • pattern

        public abstract java.lang.String pattern
        Deprecated. Not yet supported.
        Regex pattern for validation - currently not supported.
        Returns:
        The regex validation pattern.
        Default:
        ""

      • messageMinLength

        public abstract java.lang.String messageMinLength
        Message displayed when minimum length is not reached - you can use %d as placeholder for the actual value.
        Returns:
        The Message
        Default:
        "Please enter at least %d characters."

      • messageMaxLength

        public abstract java.lang.String messageMaxLength
        Message displayed when maximum length is exceeded - you can use %d as placeholder for the actual value.
        Returns:
        The Message
        Default:
        "Please enter max. %d characters."
